message.name: gen_opt_description
message.value:
About URL Rewriting
URL rewriting not only adds relevant keywords to your forum URLs but also consolidates multiple (different) URLs into ONE URL for EACH unique resource. This second benefit enhances your site's internal linking structure by creating a network of consistent links that allow search engines to properly find and index your site's unique content. A consistent link structure also ensures incoming links ALWAYS "create value" by pointing to main content pages and never to secondary or duplicate entries, thus increasing relevancy for your core content with each back-link.

IMPORTANT: This is a SET-IT AND FORGET-IT! feature. Once you select your URL structure here, it is STRONGLY recommended NOT changing these settings again. Doing so will directly impact URL integrity, losing valuable incoming links and search engine positioning.

message.name: redir_desc
message.value:
301 Redirect Original Content
'301 redirects' are "Google's Safe" way of moving content. Enable this option to redirect all previously dynamic generated pages to the new, static content. This option saves 'Page Ranking' gained from old incoming links.

Note: It is recommended to leave this setting always ON.

message.name: domname_desc
message.value:
Include Domain Name in URLs?
Search engines are thought to be more likely to follow links with absolute URLs (www.yourdomain.com/this_page.html). Enable this option to include your domain name in your forum links, thus, making your URLs look absolute (vs. relative).

message.name: noneng_desc
message.value:
Replace Non-English Characters in URLs?
Select 'Yes' to replace non-English characters with their English equivalent. Enable this option if your forums are not in English or if any non-English characters occur in your forums (E.g. Café)

message.name: redirext_desc
message.value:
Redirect ALL External URLs Posted in Private Forums
Enable this option to redirect all external links posted in private forums through an internal script. This will hide URLs from your private forums in server logs on external sites, thus protecting your privacy.

Note: The URLs will look like 'http://www.yourdormain.com/forums/redirect-to/?redirect=http://www.externaldomain.com'

message.name: email_desc
message.value:
Rewrite System Email URLs?
Set this option to 'Yes' to have vBSEO rewrite automatic notification emails.

Note: This option works ONLY with vB 3.5.x or higher

message.name: link_desc
message.value:
Link Back to the vBSEO Admin Control Panel?
This feature will set a temporary link to this control panel at the top of your vBulletin forum pages, and works as a great time-saver while setting up your static URLs. NOTE: This link is only viewable by vBulletin forum admins (Usergroup 6).

message.name: fnf_desc
message.value:
"File Not Found" requests handling?
Select how 'File Not found' requests will be handled:
- Redirect to homepage
- Send 404 HTTP code and show a 'Page not found' message
- Include custom error page. NOTE: The filename should include the absolute path. (example: /home/user/public_html/error.php)

message.name: redire_hp
message.value: Redirect to homepage

message.name: send_404
message.value: Send 404 HTTP code

message.name: inc_custom
message.value: Include custom script

message.name: exclpages_desc
message.value:
Exclude Pages?
Use regular expressions here to exclude scripts and/or pages from being affected by vBSEO. This prevents rewriting as well as copyright insertion.

Examples:(separate multiple expressions with returns)
^index\.php\?do=feature
VBGooglemap.php
geek-gallery-popup.php

message.name: botact_desc
message.value:
Log Spider Activity in your Forums?
Set this option to 'Yes' to log Search Engine Spider activity on your Forums. This option requires the vBSEO Google / Yahoo Sitemap Generator installed.

Note: Access your spider activity logs via your sitemap reports interface

message.name: analytics_desc
message.value:
Add Google Analytics Code to your Forum Pages?
Select "Yes" to add the Google Analytics code to all your forum pages. Google Analytics provides an easy way to monitor your traffic performance for both, organic and paid search engine results.

message.name: analytics_code_desc
message.value:
Enter your Google Analytics Code
Enter your Google Analytics Code in the following format: UA-9999-1

message.name: analytics_track_desc
message.value:
Add Google Analytics "Tracking External Link Clicks" Code?
Select "Yes" to add the Google Analytics External Link Tracking code to all your external links. This feature enables you to track clicks on outbound links via your Google Analytics account.

message.name: analytics_format_desc
message.value:
Enter format for Google Analytics External Links Tracking
Enter your Google Analytics External Links Tracking format.
Example: /outgoing/

message.name: funnel_desc
message.value:
Enable Google Analytics Funnel for Member Registrations?
Select "Yes" to add the Google Analytics code to all pages within your forum member registration process.

NOTE: You should create a new "Goal" in your Analytics account for your forums site and add the following steps for it (number of steps depends on whether you have enabled "Use COPPA Registration System" in vB admincp or not):
/google-funnel/coppaform.html (if applicable)
/google-funnel/enter-birthday.html (if applicable)
/google-funnel/agreement.html
/google-funnel/regform-show.html
/google-funnel/regform-submit.html
/google-funnel/registration-complete.html

What is a funnel?

message.name: adsense_desc
message.value:
Enable Adsense Section Targeting? BETA
Select "Yes" to add Google AdSense section tags to relevant parts of your forum pages within forumhome, forumdisplay and showthread.

message.name: arcopt_desc
message.value:
Archive Options:

301 Redirect vB's Archive Thread Pages
'301 redirects' are "Google's Safe" way of moving content. Select this option to save your 'Page Ranking' while redirecting spiders (and users) to the new, static pages.

Rewrite vB's Archive Thread Pages
This option rewrites URLs so that original content is linked from within the archives, providing an excellent vBulletin sitemap.

Rewrite + 301 Redirect Archive Pages
This is a combination of options 1 and 2 (above). This option rewrites URLs so that original content is linked from within the archives AND also adds 301 redirects to the archive thread pages. Therefore, (a) it works as a sitemap for the static site and (b) it ensures that incoming links pointing to the old archive thread pages are redirected to the new, static pages also.

Keep vB's Archive default settings
Keep vBulletin's default archive settings.

message.name: arcroot_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Archive Root:
Use this feature to replace the default '/archive/index.php/' part of the archive pages to a more search engine friendly version.

NOTE: Old archive root URLs will be 301 redirected to the new custom formats. Therefore, previously indexed archive pages will still be found by both users and spiders.

Sample Custom Strings:
/hello/google/ or /sitemap/ or /archive/ etc.

message.value: vBSEO 'URL Rewrite Settings' Forums

message.name: sep_desc
message.value:
Define Separator for URL Parts
This character will separate individual words in rewritten URLs. Using [ - ] is recommended.

message.name: limurl_desc
message.value:
Limit URL Length
Some users prefer to limit the length of their URLs. This setting "crops" URL parts, i.e. [forum_title] and [thread_title] to a maximum number of keywords.

NOTE: Set this parameter to zero (0) for unlimited length.

message.name: pathbits_desc
message.value:
Define Forum Path Title Bits
Define how forum parts (within URLs) are going to appear when using [forum_path] in the URL formats below.

NOTE: Use [forum_id] or [forum_title] or both - In the rare instance that you have two forums with the same name, you will need to include the [forum_id] to prevent conflicts.

Sample Custom String:
f[forum_id]

message.name: rw_forum_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Forum URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have forum URLs rewritten.

message.name: forum_format_desc
message.value:
Forum
Create a virtual multi-level forum path using [forum_path] or show only the forum name (or id) using the variables [forum_title] or [forum_id]

NOTE: In the rare instance you have two forums with the same name, you will need to include the variable [forum_id] to prevent conflicts.

Sample Custom String:
f[forum_id].html

message.name: forum_pformat_desc
message.value:
Forum Pagination
Define how the index URLs for each forum with multiple pages will appear.

NOTE: In the rare instance you have two forums with the same name, you will need to include the variable [forum_id] to prevent conflicts.

Sample Custom String:
f[forum_id]-[forum_page].html

message.name: rw_ann_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Announcement URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have announcement URLs rewritten.

message.name: ann_format_desc
message.value:
Announcement
Select an announcement URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Since announcements are posted by admins or moderators, there is little risk of having two announcements with the same title. Therefore, it is often safe not to use [announcement_id] in this setting.

NOTE: Since announcements are associated with forums, you MUST include a forum identifier such as [forum_id] or [forum_title]. You MUST also include either the [announcement_id] or [announcement_title] variable.

Sample custom string:
f[forum_id]-announcement[announcement_id].html

message.name: ann_pformat_desc
message.value:
Multiple Announcements
Select the 'View All Announcements' page URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Since announcements are associated with forums, you MUST include a forum identifier such as [forum_id] or [forum_title]. Do NOT include the variables [announcement_id] or [announcement_title].

Sample custom string:
f[forum_id]-announcements.html

message.name: rw_thread_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Thread URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to rewrite thread URLs.

message.name: thread_format_desc
message.value:
Thread
Select a thread URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: You should always include [thread_id] within your URL format since threads can often have the same titles.

Sample custom string:
t[thread_id].html

message.name: thread_pformat_desc
message.value:
Thread Pagination
Define how individual thread pages URLs with multiple pages will appear.

NOTE: You should always include [thread_id] within your URL format since threads can often have the same titles.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-[thread_page].html

message.name: thread_gformat_desc
message.value:
GARS Article View (garpg)
Define how individual GARS Article View URLs with multiple pages will appear.

NOTE: You should always include [thread_id] within your URL format since threads can often have the same titles.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-[thread_page].html

message.name: thread_lpformat_desc
message.value:
'Last Post in Thread' Redirect
Define how links to 'last posts in threads' will appear.

NOTE: The native redirection functionality is used to redirect the user to the appropriate anchored post within the thread (i.e. thead_title.html#post-xxxx)

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-last-post.html

message.name: thread_gpformat_desc
message.value:
'Go To Post in Thread' Redirect
Define how links to 'go to posts in threads' will appear.

NOTE: The native redirection functionality is used to redirect the user to the appropriate anchored post within the thread (i.e. thead_title.html#post-xxxx)

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-post[post_id].html

message.name: thread_gppformat_desc
message.value:
'Go To Post in Thread' Pagination Redirect
Define how links to multi pages 'go to posts in threads' will appear.

NOTE: The native redirection functionality is used to redirect the user to the appropriate anchored post within the thread (i.e. thead_title.html#post-xxxx)

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-post[post_id]-[thread_page].html

message.name: thread_ptformat_desc
message.value:
'Previous Thread' Redirect
Define how links to 'previous threads' will appear. These are the links at the bottom of thread pages.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-prev-thread.html

message.name: thread_ntformat_desc
message.value:
'Next Thread' Redirect
Define how links to 'next threads' will appear. These are the links at the bottom of thread pages.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-next-thread.html

message.name: rw_pthread_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Printthread URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have print version (printthread.php) of URLs rewritten.

message.name: pthread_rel_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to the Printthread links?
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to Printthread. It is thought that printable versions of threads (printthread.php) may be considered "duplicate content" by search engines and possibly penalized or excluded.

message.name: pthread_format_desc
message.value:
'Printthread'
Define how links to the 'printable version of threads' will appear.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-print.html

message.name: pthread_pformat_desc
message.value:
'Printthread' Pagination
Define how 'printable version of threads' with multiple pages will appear.

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-print-[thread_page].html

message.name: rw_post_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Showpost URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have single versions of posts (showpost.php) URLs rewritten.

message.name: post_rel_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to the Showpost links?
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to single versions of posts (showpost.php). Individual post pages might be considered "duplicate content" by search engines.

Smart rel="nofollow" for Showpost links?
This option prevents search engines from following showpost links conditional to the amount of postings in a thread. If there is only one (1) post in a page, rel="nofollow" will be applied to showpost (as both showpost & showthread are virtually the same). If there are two (2) or more postings in a page, rel="nofollow" will NOT be added, thus allowing search engines to follow all showpost links.

message.name: smart
message.value: Smart

message.name: post_format_desc
message.value:
'Showpost'
Define how links to 'single versions of threads' will appear.

Sample Custom String:
[post_id]-[post_count]-post.html

message.name: urls_poll
message.value: Poll URLs

message.name: rw_poll_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Poll URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have poll URLs rewritten.

message.name: poll_format_desc
message.value:
Poll
Select a poll URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: We recommend using [poll_id] within your URL format since there is a chance that users will post polls with the same title.

Sample custom string:

message.name: rw_memb_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Member Profile URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have profile URLs rewritten.

message.name: memb_format_desc
message.value:
Member Profile
Select a member profile URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Since vBulletin does not allow for duplicate usernames, it is safe not to use the [user_id] variable.

Sample custom string:
u[user_id].html

message.name: rw_mlist_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Member's List URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have member index pages URLs rewritten.

message.name: mlist_format_desc
message.value:
Member's List
Define how the member's list index URL will appear.

Sample custom string:
users.html

message.name: mlist_pformat_desc
message.value:
Member's List Pagination
Define how member index URLs with multiple pages will appear.

Sample custom string:
users-[page].html

message.name: mlist_lformat_desc
message.value:
Member's List 'By Letter' Pages
Define how individual member's list indexes by letter URLs will appear.

Sample custom string:
users-[letter][page].html

message.name: rw_avatar_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Custom Avatar URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have custom avatar URLs rewritten.

message.name: avatar_format_desc
message.value:
Custom Avatar
Define how custom avatar image URLs will appear.

NOTE: 'avatars/' will be added automatically to the address to prevent conflicting image URLs.

NOTE: Since vBulletin does not allow for duplicate usernames, it is safe not to use the [user_id] variable.

Sample custom string:
u[user_id].html

message.name: rw_navbul_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Nav Bullet Image URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have tree URLs rewritten.

message.name: navbul_format_desc
message.value:
Forum Nav Bullet Image URLs
Define how nav bullet image URLs for forums will appear.

NOTE: 'images/' will be added automatically to the address to prevent conflicting image URLs.

Sample custom string:
f[forum_id].gif

message.name: navbul_tformat_desc
message.value:
Thread Nav Bullet Image URLs
Define how nav bullet image URLs for threads will appear.

NOTE: 'images/' will be added automatically to the address to prevent conflicting image URLs.

Sample custom string:
t[thread_id].gif

message.name: rw_attach_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Attachment URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have attachment URLs rewritten.

message.name: attach_format_desc
message.value:
Attachment
Google and other search engines index image (.gif, .jpg, .png, etc.) and other file types such as Word documents (.doc) and Adobe PDF documents (.pdf). A special variable [original_filename] has been created so that attachments keep their original filename AND extension in the URL.

NOTE: 'attachments/' will be added automatically to the url to prevent conflicting image URLs.

NOTE: We recommend using [attachment_id] within your URL format since there is a chance that users will post attachments with the same 'original filename'.

Sample custom string:
[attachment_id]-[original_filename]

message.name: crrs_forum
message.value: vBSEO 'Custom Rewrite Rules' Forums

message.name: crrs_def
message.value:
Define Custom Rewrite Rules BETA
You can apply vBSEO's Rewrite Engine to URLs not modified by the default feature set. Define your own rules using a regular expression format:

message.name: crrs_desc
message.value:
Both parts (left & right) are regular expressions: the first part is the original URL, while the second one is the rewritten URL using the matched pattern of the first part.

NOTE: The vBSEO Team will NOT provide "official" support for the regular expressions you enter when using this feature. Please use this feature ONLY if you know what you are doing. For further help, please visit the vBSEO forums at http://www.vbseo.com.

NOTE: Lines can be commented out by preceding them with two forward slashes (//). If any of your rewrite rules contain errors they will be automatically commented out when you click 'Save Settings'.

Examples:
'article\.php\?id=(\d+)'=>'showarticle-$1.html'
'browse\.php\?page=(\d+)'=>'listing-$1.htm'

message.name: metakw_desc
message.value:
Replace the 'META KEYWORDS' Content?
Replaces the 'META KEYWORDS' dynamically with content relevant to the page being displayed. Affects forums, threads, posts & member profiles.

message.name: bookmark_threadpost
message.value: Display Icons in Both, Threads and Posts

message.name: bookmark_custom
message.value: add custom

message.name: bookmark_services_desc
message.value:
Enter additional Bookmarking Services below in the format:
Bookmark URL,Icon URL,"Bookmark Thread" Text,"Bookmark Post" Text

message.name: bookmark_none
message.value: Do Not Display Icons

message.name: bookmark_thread
message.value: Display Icons for Threads Only

message.name: metadesc_desc
message.value:
Replace the 'META DESCRIPTION' Content?
This option replaces the 'META DESCRIPTION' content with the first words of the first posting in the page to a limit defined in the option below.

message.name: metadesc_len_desc
message.value:
Define the 'META DESCRIPTION' Length?
The meta description tag usually consists of 150 to 200 characters or less.

message.name: nextprev_desc
message.value:
Replace 'Previous/Next Thread' redirect links?
Enable this option to replace the 'Next Thread' & 'Previous Thread' links with direct, Content Relevant links. Note: This option adds two queries.

message.name: dir_links_threads_desc
message.value:
Direct Links to Threads For Guest Visitors?
This option replaces links to "First Unread Post in Thread" with direct links to Threads. Giving direct (not redirected) access for guests and spiders to your thread content.
It also strips the "New-Post" functionality from RSS feeds, enabling the same effect for guests and spiders reaching your board via RSS and RSS2 feeds.

NOTE: This option would reduce functionality for non-members, but could be considered an acceptable tradeoff for SEO.

message.name: bookmark_desc
message.value:
Display Social Bookmarking Icons
Social Bookmarking has evolved as a very effective way of sharing content with others and consequently bringing more traffic to your website. Check the Social Bookmarking Icons to be displayed in your forum pages.

Social Bookmarking Icons Display Options:

Display Icons in Both, Threads and Posts
Select this option to display social bookmarking icons for both, threads and posts within threads. Note that thread bookmarking icons appear within the 'LinkBack' drop-down menu, while post bookmarking icons appear at the bottom-left corner of each post.

Display Icons For Threads Only
Select this option to display social bookmark icons for threads and not for posts individually. Thread bookmarking icons will appear only within the 'LinkBack' drop-down menu.

* Enter <!--VBSEO_BOOKMARKS--> in your "postbit" (or "postbit_legacy") template if you want to specify a different location for the social bookmarking icons. By default, post bookmarking icons will appear at the bottom-left corner of each post.

message.name: bookmark_thread_desc
message.value:
Display Social Bookmarking Icons For Threads
Select "Yes" to enable Social Bookmarking Icons for Threads.

message.name: bookmark_post_desc
message.value:
Display Social Bookmarking Icons For Posts
Select "Yes" to enable Social Bookmarking Icons for Posts.

message.name: bookmark
message.value: Social Bookmarking

message.name: flinks_desc
message.value:
Replace 'Forum Links' with direct links to target URLs?
Enable this option to replace your 'Forum Links' with the direct target URLs.

NOTE: These Forum Links are the ones that would commonly be redirected when entering URLs via the Forum Manager in the admincp.

message.name: addttl_desc
message.value:
Add Thread Titles to Showthread Links Anchor Text?
Enable this option to create keyword-rich links by adding thread titles to URLs that point to showthread pages.

NOTE: This option works ONLY with vB 3.5.x or higher

Add Thread Title Options:

Do NOT add thread titles
Keep vB's original functionality. Links posted in threads/posts are not modified.

ADD thread titles as "popup text"
This option adds the target thread title to the 'title' (popup) tag of every link that points to a showthread page.

ADD thread titles as "original-text (thread title)"
This is a combination of options 1 and 2 (above). The original link (text) is left untouched while the 'thread title' is added (within parenthesis) right after it.

REPLACE original anchor text
This option replaces any link pointing to a showthread page with the corresponding thread title.

*Links pointing to private forums are NOT replaced to prevent privacy issues (i.e. people determining titles of private forum threads by writing random 'showthread.php?t=xxxx' in postings)

message.name: addttlext_desc
message.value:
Add Page Titles to External Links Anchor Text?
Enable this option to create keyword-rich links by adding page titles to URLs that point to external domains. vBSEO will connect to external sites when new links are posted and extract the page title from them.

NOTE: This option works ONLY with vB 3.5.x or higher

message.name: attl_1
message.value: Do NOT add thread titles

message.name: attl_2
message.value: ADD thread titles as "popup text"

message.name: attl_3
message.value: ADD thread titles as "original-text (thread title)"

message.name: attl_4
message.value: REPLACE original anchor text

message.name: addttlp_desc
message.value:
Add Thread Titles to Showpost Links Anchor Text?
Same link replacements as above but for showpost URLs.

message.name: remstop_desc
message.value:
Remove Stopwords from URLs?
Removing "stopwords" from URLs may increase relevancy for specific searches as some search engines filter these common words when people use them in their search queries.

Smart Stopword Removal from URLs?
Enabling this option filters "stopwords" from URLs ONLY when titles are longer than the specified number within the 'Limit URL Length' setting.

message.name: stopdef_desc
message.value:
Define Stopwords
When the above feature is enabled, the following words will be ommitted in the URLs.

TIP: Find common stopwords for other languages in http://www.ranks.nl/stopwords/

message.name: acronym_def_desc
message.value:
Define Acronyms
Enter acronym replacements (1 per line). Acronym expansion will be applied to these keywords as defined in the option above.

NOTE: Acronyms are not case sensitive.

Examples:
'seo'=>'Search Engine Optimization'
'pr'=>'Page Ranking'

message.name: acronym_desc
message.value:
Acronym Expansion
This feature is great for increasing SE relevancy. It allows you to replace common acronyms for real phrases in your thread content and titles.

Properly defining acronyms also improves accessibility and aids in establishing relevancy for terms often omitted due to acronym usage. It also increases the semantic value of your user generated content while improving usability (i.e. - making your site easier to use), all these benefits go hand-on-hand with improved SEO.

Acronym Expansion Options:

Do NOT add expand acronyms
Acronyms are not modified.

REPLACE acronyms as expanded text
This option converts matching acronyms to the corresponding text as defined in the field below.

ADD 'acronym' html tag to acronyms
This option wraps each acronym around an 'acronym' html tag with the corresponding text as a name attribute.

ADD 'abbr' html tag to acronyms
Same as above but using the 'abbr' html tag, as opposed to the 'acronym' html tag.

message.name: acro_opt1
message.value: Do NOT add expand acronyms

message.name: acro_opt2
message.value: REPLACE acronyms as expanded text

message.name: acro_opt3
message.value: ADD 'acronym' html tag to acronyms

message.name: acro_opt4
message.value: ADD 'abbr' html tag to acronyms

message.name: acro_url_desc
message.value:
Apply Acronym Expansion to URLs?
Select "Yes" if you want to replace keywords in the URLs.

message.name: acro_content_desc
message.value:
Apply Acronym Expansion to "Content Areas" only?
Select "Yes" to replace keywords in thread replies, blog entries and comments ONLY. Otherwise keywords will be replaced anywhere they occur: thread titles, navigation links, thread lists, etc.

message.name: acro_guests_desc
message.value:
Apply Acronym Expansion for "Guests" only? NEW!
Select "Yes" to replace keywords for unregistered visitors ONLY. Otherwise keywords will be replaced for all visitors.

message.name: acro_text_desc
message.value:
Apply Acronym Expansion to all text?
Select "Yes" if you want to replace keywords in the text.

message.name: will_replace
message.value: will be replaced by

message.name: forceroot_desc
message.value:
Force Forum Root as Homepage?
When enabled, all links to your forum homepage will be directed to 'vbroot/'. If disabled, your forum homepage links will point to the 'script name' (E.g. forum.php) as defined in your vBulletin configuration settings. This allows users with high PageRank in 'index.php' to use it as their default homepage.

message.name: hpalias_desc
message.value:
Define Homepage Aliases
This feature will help consolidate PR (Google PageRank) in your forum homepage. Many established forums will have different PRs in forum home (usually up to three), as an example:

www.yoursite.com/forums/ (PR = A)
www.yoursite.com/forums/index.php (PR = B)
www.yoursite.com/forums/index.php? (PR = C)

This is a typical "PageRank Leakage" issue and might also lead search engines to tag these pages as duplicate content.

Filenames entered here will be 301 redirected to your forum's homepage as defined through your vBulletin's Admin CP. Enter one (1) filename per line.

Examples:
index.php
index.php?

message.name: intrel_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to ALL Sorting Links
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to pages with the same content, but sorted differently. These pages might be tagged as "duplicate content". Therefore, we recommend enabling this feature.

message.name: reldyn_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to ALL Dynamic Pages
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following ALL dynamic links. Some examples are: 'Post Reply' links, 'Quote' links and 'Quick Reply' or 'Search' links. These pages have non-relevant (or "noise") content which should not be indexed by search engines , resulting in better SEO.

message.name: relmemb_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to Links pointing TO Member Profiles FROM Postbit
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to member profiles found in posts.

message.name: relmemb_home_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to Links pointing TO Member Profiles FROM Forumhome
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to member profiles found in your Forum Homepage.

message.name: extrel_desc
message.value:
Add rel="nofollow" to ALL External URLs
Enable this option to prevent search engines from following links to external pages (URLs that point to other domains).

message.name: extwhite_desc
message.value:
External domains "Whitelist"
Enter domains to be excluded from the above rule. Rel='nofollow' WILL NOT be added to links pointing to domains in this list. Note: This can be used to give the benefit of NON rel='nofollowed' signatures to a group of friends.

Examples:
google.com (no 'http://www' required)
groups.google.com

message.name: clean_html_desc
message.value:
Cleanup HTML code?
Select 'Yes' to remove unnecessary whitespace characters and HTML comments from the source code of your forum pages. This increases the C2C (Content to Code) ratio and reduces page sizes, resulting in a net performance increase and reduction in bandwidth required.

NOTE: If comments (or HTML tags) within your pages are not closed correctly with their corresponding end tags, then this option could cause your pages to display incorrectly. Be sure that your templates contain error free HTML tags and code.

message.name: rem_prev_desc
message.value:
Remove Thread Preview Text For Guest Visitors?
Thread titles in forumdisplay links often contain "contributory" keywords related to the parent forum. Removing the thread preview text for unregistered visitors may help increase the relevant keyword ratio for these pages.

NOTE: Thread Preview Text is the text that appears when hovering thread links within the forumdisplay links.

message.name: img_size_desc
message.value:
Enable Dimension Attributes for IMG tags?
Select "Yes" to enable the Image Size Attributes feature.

message.name: img_def_desc
message.value:
Define Dimension Attributes
vB default templates do not include "width" and "height" attributes for images. Providing image dimensions for all images within your forum will speed-up page rendering in most Web browsers. Forcing image dimensions also ensures that search engines can better determine the relationship of images to surrounding text when calculating the keyword relevancy of your forum pages.

Examples:
'thread.gif'=>'20x20'
'icon12.gif'=>'16x16'

Examples (including folders to distinguish images with the same name):
'buttons/quote.gif' => '70x22'
'editor/quote.gif' => '21x20'

message.name: img_note
message.value: NOTE: If you have changed your forum's default image sizes, you MUST update the dimensions above before enabling this feature. Otherwise, all non-conforming images will be distorted.

message.name: max_chars
message.value: 150 to 200 characters max. recommended

message.name: rights_reserved
message.value: All Rights Reserved

message.name: rr_forumdisplay
message.value: on forumdisplay pages (and)

message.name: rr_showthread
message.value: on showthread pages.

message.name: rr_blog
message.value: on blog pages.

message.name: save_key
message.value: Save Key

message.name: rrs_def
message.value:
Define Relevant Replacements
Build dynamic phrases that get replaced by entering simple comments (up to three) in your forum templates.

message.name: rrs_desc
message.value:
For each set, the first phrase will be displayed ONLY in forumdisplay pages and the second phrase will be displayed ONLY in showthread pages.

You may use any of the patterns defined below to build your phrases:
[bb_title] - Your forum's main title
[default_keywords] - Your keywords as defined in vB's admincp

[forum_title] - The current forum's title
[forum_description] - The current forum's description

[parent_forum_title] - The parent forum's title
[parent_forum_description] - The parent forum's description

[thread_title] - The current thread's title (Use ONLY on showthread pages)
[first_post_X_words] - First X number of words from the page's first posting (Use ONLY on showthread pages)
[thread_X_tags] - First X tags assigned to a thread (Use ONLY on showthread pages)

[thread_page] - The thread's page number

Sample Relevant Phrases:
[Forum_title] discussions within the [parent_forum_title] at the [bb_title] (on forumdisplay pages)
Discuss [thread_title] at the [forum_title] within the [bb_title]; <em>[first_post_15_words]...</em> (on showthread pages)

message.name: catlinks
message.value: Direct Category Links

message.name: catlinks_desc
message.value:
Direct Category Links?
Set this option to "Yes" to enable anchor type links for forum categories.

NOTE: Link to categories will look like "http://yourforumsroot/#category_title"

message.name: rrs_forum
message.value: vBSEO 'Relevant Replacements' Forums

message.name: extblack_desc
message.value:
External domains "Blacklist"
The following domains will ALWAYS have rel='nofollow' added to the links regardless of other configuration settings.

Examples:

groups.google.com

message.name: linkback_black_desc

LinkBacks from these domains will ALWAYS be excluded.

Examples:

message.name: thread_npformat_desc
message.value:
'Newest Post in Thread' Redirect
Define how links to 'newest posts in threads' will appear.

NOTE: The native redirection functionality is used to redirect the user to the appropriate anchored post within the thread (i.e. thead_title.html#post-xxxx)

Sample Custom String:
t[thread_id]-new-post.html

message.name: metadesc_members_desc
message.value:
Meta Description for Member Profiles
Define a custom format for the meta description tag of member profile pages. You may use the following patterns for automatic replacements:

[username] - Member username
[usertitle] - Member user title ("Moderator", "Registered Member", etc.)
[bb_title] - Your forum's main title
[user_field_1], [user_field_2], etc. - Custom user fields as defined in the vB Admin CP

Sample Meta Description Phrase:
[username] is a [usertitle] in the [bb_title]. View [username]'s profile.

Enable Outgoing Pingbacks

message.name: pingback_notify_desc
message.value:
Email Notifications on Incoming LinkBacks

message.name: trackback_desc
message.value:
Enable Outgoing Trackbacks
Select "Yes" to enable outgoing trackbacks for new threads.

Note: The trackback field is displayed when creating a new thread or when replying to a thread in advanced view.

message.name: in_trackback_desc
message.value:
Enable Incoming Trackbacks

Note: Incoming trackback moderation for individual forums is set via your vBulletin Admin CP in: Forums and Moderators > Forum Manager > Edit Forum

message.name: in_refback_desc
message.value:
Enable Incoming Refbacks
Select "Yes" to enable automatic backlinks to referring URLs.

Note: Incoming Refback moderation for individual forums is set via your vBulletin Admin CP in:
Forums and Moderators > Forum Manager > Edit Forum

message.name: in_pingback_desc
message.value:
Enable Incoming Pingbacks
Select "Yes" to enable incoming pingbacks for discussions.

Note: Incoming pingback moderation for individual forums is set via your vBulletin Admin CP in: Forums and Moderators > Forum Manager > Edit Forum

message.name: postbit_pingback_desc
message.value:
Enable "Permalink" indicators in Postbits
Permalinks are basically links that point to posts as anchors in threads, allowing users to reference specific posts for incoming LinkBacks.

Permalink options:

Display Permalink in Postbit content
Will add the "Permalink" link above your post content, within the title area.

Display Permalink beside Showpost Link
Will add the "Permalink" link to the right of your showpost links.

Replace post number link with Permalink
Will replace individual showpost links with the "Permalink" link. Note: Posts will no longer be accessible individually.

Do not add Permalink indicator in Postbit
Not recommended if LinkBacks are enabled on your forums.

* You can add <!--PERMALINK_INFO--> to your postbit (or posbit_legacy) template to define a custom location for your "Permalink" link.

message.name: vbseo_affid
message.value:
Your vBSEO Affiliate ID HOT!
Earn Back 'Your vBSEO' Product Fees and More! Enter your vBSEO affiliate ID here to have the copyright footer link to your affiliate landing page.

More info: http://www.vbseo.com/aff/

message.name: custom301
message.value: Custom Redirects

message.name: custom301_def
message.value:
Define Custom 301 Redirects BETA
You can setup the 301 redirection rules here. This can be used if you moved the location of certain document at your server.

message.name: custom301_desc
message.value:
Both parts (left & right) are regular expressions: the first part is the original URL, while the second one is the redirected URL using the matched pattern of the first part.

NOTE: The vBSEO Team will NOT provide "official" support for the regular expressions you enter when using this feature. Please use this feature ONLY if you know what you are doing.

NOTE: Lines can be commented out by preceding them with two forward slashes (//). If any of your rewrite rules contain errors they will be automatically commented out when you click 'Save Settings'.

Examples:
'article-(\d+)\.html'=>'articles/entry-$1.html'
'forum(\d+)\.html'=>'f$1/'

message.value:
Rewrite Attachment Alt Tag Attribute?

message.name: attach_alt_format_desc

Attachment Alt Tag attribute Format

[original_filename]

Incoming LinkBack Keyword Ignore List

message.name: forum_jump_desc
message.value:
Remove Forumjump Dropdown For Guest Visitors
The forumjump dropdown generates extra non-relevant HTML code, especially on larger, multiple-forum sites. Disable it for guests (and spiders) to lighten the content Search Engines will index. This will increase the content to code ratio which is desirable for SEO purposes.

NOTE: The Forumjump Dropdown appears at the bottom of your thread and forum pages. There's also an option via the vBulletin admincp to disable it completely.

message.name: lang_dir

message.name: arcorder_desc
message.value:
Invert archive thread display order:
By default, the archive (or sitemap) thread links are displayed from oldest to newest. Enable this option to invert your sitemap thread display order (display newest theads first), creating a hierarchical structure that links to the most recent content which naturally is the most important content in your forums.

message.name: cleanup_lastpost_links
message.value: Remove Last Post Links For Guest Visitors

message.name: cleanup_lastpost_column
message.value: Remove Last Post Column For Guest Visitors

message.name: cleanup_lastpost_none
message.value: Keep Default Last Post Settings

message.name: cleanup_lastpost_desc
message.value:
Remove Last Post Links Options:

Remove Last Post Links For Guest Visitors
This option will remove last post links on forumhome for guest visitors. These links contain redirects that some SEO's might prefer to keep to a minimum.

Remove Last Post Column For Guest Visitors
Select this option to completely remove the last post column on forumhome for guest visitors. In addition to removing the last post links (option above), this option will increase your content to code ratio while reducing bandwidth consumed by your forum homepage.

Keep Default Last Post Settings
Select this option to keep the default last post links settings.

NOTE: This option would reduce functionality for non-members, but could be considered an acceptable tradeoff for SEO.

message.name: rem_member_dropdown_desc
message.value:
Remove Member DHTML Popup Dropdowns in Postbit For Guest Visitors?
Select this option to remove the DHTML Popup Window displayed for member usernames in posts for guest visitors. This option will remove non-relevant content from your thread output for guests (and spiders), increasing your content to code ratio while reducing bandwidth used in your thread pages.

NOTE: This option would reduce functionality for non-members, but could be considered an acceptable tradeoff for SEO.

message.name: urls_blog
message.value: vBulletin Blog URLs

message.name: rw_blog_desc
message.value:
Rewrite Blog URLs?
Set this option to "Yes" to have vBulletin Blog URLs rewritten.

message.name: blogind_format_desc
message.value:
Blog Entry
Select a blog entry URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: You should always include [blog_id] within your URL format since blog entries can often have the same titles.

Sample custom string:
blogs/b[blog_id].html

message.name: bloguser_format_desc
message.value:
Blog
Select a blog URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Since vBulletin does not allow for duplicate usernames, it is safe not to use the [user_id] when using the [user_name] variable.

Sample custom string:
blogs/u[user_id].html

message.name: blogcat_format_desc
message.value:
Blog Category
Select the blog category URL format for users or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Duplicate categories for a single user is an unlikely scenario, so you may skip the [category_id] variable for this setting to have a "cleaner URL".

NOTE: Since categories are associated to users, you MUST include a user identifier such as [user_id] or [user_name]. You MUST also include either the [category_id] or [category_title] variable in the URL format.

Sample custom string:
blogs/u[user_id]-c[category_id].html

message.name: blogglobcat_format_desc
message.value:
Blog Global Category NEW!
Select the blog global category URL format or create a custom layout using the field provided.

NOTE: Duplicate global categories is an unlikely scenario since these are set by the administrator, so you may skip the [category_id] variable for this setting to have a "cleaner URL".

Sample custom string:
blogs/c[category_id].html

message.name: bloglist_format_desc
message.value:
"Recent Blog Entries" List
Define how the "Recent Blog Entries" list index URL will appear.

blogs/recent-entries.html

message.name: blognext_format_desc

"Next Blog Entry" Redirect
Define how links to 'Next' Blog entry links will appear. These are the links at the top of blog entry pages.

NOTE: You should always include [blog_id] within your URL format since blog entries can often have the same titles.

Sample Custom String:

message.name: blogprev_format_desc
message.value:
"Previous Blog Entry" Redirect
Define how links to 'Previous' Blog entry links will appear. These are the links at the top of blog entry pages.

NOTE: You should always include [blog_id] within your URL format since blog entries can often have the same titles.

message.name: blogday_format_desc

message.name: blogatt_format_desc

Blog Attachments
Google and other search engines index image (.gif, .jpg, .png, etc.) and other file types such as Word documents (.doc) and Adobe PDF documents (.pdf). A special variable [original_filename] has been created so that attachments keep their original filename AND extension in the URL.

NOTE: We recommend using [attachment_id] within your URL format since there is a chance that users will post attachments with the same 'original filename'.

Display Icons BELOW Blog Entry Posts

message.name: blogcatpage_format_desc

Blog Category Pagination

message.name: permalink_profile_desc
message.value:
Enable "Permalink" indicators for Profile Visitor Messages
Permalinks for Profile Visitor Messages are links that point to individual Visitor Messages as anchors in the Profile Page, allowing users to reference specific comments elswhere.

Note: This option works ONLY with vB 3.7.x or higher

Permalink options:

Display Permalink beside message date/time
Will add the "Permalink" link to the right of each message's date & time indicator.

Link message date as Permalink
Will replace individual message's date with the "Permalink" link.

Do not add Permalink indicator in Visitor Messages
Do not enable "Permalink" links for visitor messages.

* You can add <!--PERMALINK_INFO--> to your memberinfo_visitormessage template to define a custom location for your "Permalink" link.

message.name: permalink_blog_desc
message.value:
Enable "Permalink" indicators for Blog Comments
Permalinks for Blog Comments are links that point to individual Blog Comments as anchors, allowing users to reference specific comments elsewhere.

Note: This option works ONLY with vB 3.7.x or higher

Permalink options:

Display Permalink (Anchor Image) at the bottom-right of each Blog Comment
Will add the "Permalink" link image at the bottom-right of each comment.

Do not add Permalink indicator in Blog Comments
Do not enable "Permalink" links for blog comments.

* You can add <!--PERMALINK_INFO--> to your blog_comment template to define a custom location for your "Permalink" link.

message.name: ignore_linkback_dupe_desc
message.value:
Ignore Linkbacks from Duplicate URLs?
Select "Yes" to have vBSEO ignore Linkbacks coming from duplicate URLs.

Using a special algorithm, vBSEO will attempt to identify when a new Linkback is a duplicate of a previously registered Linkback, but comes from a different URL. The source of these duplicate Linkbacks are often forums or publishing platforms with flawed navigational architecture, that display the same content under multiple URLs.

message.name: virt_html
message.value: Virtual HTML Display

message.name: virt_html_desc
message.value:
Apply Virtual HTML Display to vB Notices NEW!
Optimize the relevancy of each page's first text, increase C2C (Content to Code) ratio, and eliminate non-relevant text elements and links by enabling vBSEO to represent general vBulletin notices (at the top of your pages) using Javascript.

This approach effectively removes the actual vB Notices from the HTML source, and increases the relevancy of the rest of the page's content, while leaving the actual page unchanged for the user.

Additionally, any template code placed between the following tags will also be rendered with Javascript and removed, allowing the flexibility to replace any part of the page (with low quality content or links) with a JS version to minimize SEO impact.

<!--VBSEO_VIRTUAL_HTML-->
code here
<!--/VBSEO_VIRTUAL_HTML-->

message.name: canonical_link
message.value: Canonical URLs

message.name: canonical_link_desc
message.value:
Enable Canonical URLs NEW!
A canonical URL is the "Preferred" URL for any page. Some pages have more than one accessible URL, creating a duplicate content problem. Google and other search engines now look for a META parameter rel="canonical", and use this as a hint to determine which URL is the correct one to index, i.e. the preferred version.

vBSEO's built in Link Consensus ensures that all pages on your forum are canonical to begin with, allowing for only one URL per resource. vBSEO's native canonical URLs provide advantages including greater crawling efficiency, optimized external linking, maximized link value. This is not provided with the rel="canonical" parameter alone. vBSEO's Application level link consensus is required for these advantages.

However, Google's canonical hints are helpful as a backup for URLs such as custom sorted pages. This level of redundancy will ensure that if search engines ever discover the sorting URLs, they will be instructed of the correct page URL for link consensus the first time they crawl the page. Examples include custom sorted versions of forumdisplay, social group discussions, member and blog lists, etc.

message.name: segmentation_desc
message.value:
Google Segmentation Tracking NEW!
This is an integration feature for Google Analytics, providing admins with the ability to segment and view their stats by usergroup.

Using the "Basic Segmentation" option, visitors to your forum will be tracked and segmented into "Guest" and "Member" groups. This allows you to compare the difference in activity between the two groups.

Using the more advanced "Enhanced Segmentation" option, you can track and segment your traffic into every different user group available on your forum. View stats specifically for your guests, members, moderators, customers, and every other primary user group.

message.value: Basic Segmentation

message.value: Enhanced Segmentation

message.name: vbseo_tweetboard
message.value:
Tweetboard Integration NEW!
Tweetboard creates an instant Twitter-powered microforum for your website.

It's a great solution for engaging your readers and encourage participation while bringing traffic back to your website.

Enabling Tweetboard via vBSEO is extremely simple and convenient. Just enter your Twitter username here, and vBSEO will take care of the rest.

If you don't have a Twitter account yet, you may create on here.

More info: http://tweetboard.com
